pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:6.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six wore ornaments.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:6.4: “How can nuns wear ornaments? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.4: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear ornaments?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.5: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.8: How can the nuns from the group of six wear ornaments?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:8.1: ‘If a nun wears ornaments, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:10.2: what goes on the head, what goes around the neck, what goes on the hands, what goes on the feet, what goes around the hips.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:10.4: if she wears it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.
